alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued April 22 at 6:41PM MDT until April 22 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Taos County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Los Alamos County in north central New Mexico... Northeastern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 639 PM MDT, a large area of dust was over north central New Mexico, including the Tusas Mountains and upper Rio Grande Valley including Taos. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 343 and 407. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 44 and 113. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 91 and 251. Locations impacted include... Taos, Questa, Chama, Cuba, Jemez Springs, Dulce, Tierra Amarilla, Canon Plaza, Vallecitos and Tres Piedras. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Los Alamos; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval; Taos
